repositories.brief_summary: Major improvements to warning system UI, garbage collection performance, parser enhancements, and symbol name mangling updates merged this week
repositories.new_features_summary: Enhanced warning messages with composable formatting, improved string delimiter parsing, Format module concurrency safety, and symbol name mangling updates
repositories.new_features:
- **Warning and alert message formatting** completely redesigned with composable formatting system, improved error presentation, and better styling for command-line output ([5a5eb48](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5a5eb481c7a9d0f039e3169aa8ed19c9b926e982))
- **String delimiter parsing** enhanced to accept extended UTF-8 delimiter characters in quoted strings (`{delim||delim}`), improving Unicode support in string literals ([5a5eb48](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5a5eb481c7a9d0f039e3169aa8ed19c9b926e982))
- **Format module safety** improved with `Queue.take_opt` to prevent exceptions during concurrent access, providing better error handling for multi-domain usage ([5a5eb48](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5a5eb481c7a9d0f039e3169aa8ed19c9b926e982))
- **Symbol name mangling** updated to use `$` instead of `.` for module separation (`camlModule$name_NNN`) and `$$xx` encoding for special characters, providing consistent cross-platform identifier encoding ([703ba8e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/703ba8eac4da669f793d84452a6137f333254db2))
- **Exception and type extension locations** now include location information in AST nodes for better error reporting and tooling support ([5a5eb48](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5a5eb481c7a9d0f039e3169aa8ed19c9b926e982))
- **C++ API compatibility** improved with proper extern "C" guards in header files for better integration with C++ codebases ([b0b5f92](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/b0b5f92896002239491308d3f1651d6e548c109f))
repositories.activity_summary: Extensive work on compiler internals including GADT type checking fixes, pattern matching improvements, and major garbage collection performance optimizations
repositories.activity:
- **GADT type checking enhancements** merged with backtracking in `Ctype.unify_gadt` and optimized unification for better type inference by [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/COCTI) ([#13585](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13585))
- **Documentation and syntax fixes** including typo corrections in `HACKING.adoc` and `configure` patterns by [@shym](https://github.com/shym) ([#13652](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13652))
- **Frame pointer handling** fixes and amd64 assembly refactoring for better debugging support by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#13639](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13639), [#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13050))
- **Runtime system improvements** including mangling fixes for `caml_system$frametable` and TSan oracle updates ([#13650](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13650), [#13642](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13642))
- **Pattern matching compiler** fixes for GADT cases and protection of retyping functions to resolve warning 56 false positives ([#13600](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13600), [#13598](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13598))
- **Parsing infrastructure** updates with location tracking improvements and source printing fixes for escaped identifiers ([#13603](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13603))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on runtime performance optimization, developer experience improvements, and robust type system enhancements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Performance-focused development** with major garbage collection optimizations and runtime efficiency improvements taking priority
- **Developer experience enhancement** through better error messages, improved debugging support, and more informative compiler output
- **Robust type system evolution** with continued GADT improvements and pattern matching compiler enhancements
- **Cross-platform consistency** efforts including symbol name mangling standardization and C++ compatibility improvements
- **Code quality initiatives** with comprehensive test suite updates and TSan integration for memory safety validation
repositories.contributors_summary: Active collaboration between OCaml core team members focusing on compiler internals, runtime optimization, and tooling improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) contributed major GC performance improvements with mark-delay optimization ([#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580))
- [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) implemented shared heap free list representation changes for better sweep performance ([#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616))
- [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/COCTI) fixed GADT type checking issues and pattern matching false warnings ([#13585](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13585), [#13510](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13510), [#13600](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13600))
- [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) worked on frame pointer improvements and symbol name mangling updates ([#13639](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13639), [#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13050))
- [@shym](https://github.com/shym) provided documentation fixes and typo corrections ([#13652](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13652))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) reported C++ compilation issues on Cygwin that led to header improvements ([#13541](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13541))
- Multiple contributors worked on C++ API compatibility, warning system improvements, and parsing enhancements throughout the week

repositories.brief_summary: Documentation improvements, pin command enhancements, bug fixes, and memory management optimizations
repositories.new_features_summary: Pin list command now shows repository revision information and switch list-available bug fix
repositories.new_features:
- **Pin command enhancement** displays repository revision information when listing pinned packages from version control sources, helping users track the current state of their pinned repositories ([b2a4da8](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b2a4da8bc32da72c27ba9baa03cc70296de52f51))
- **Switch list-available fix** resolves command behavior when given multiple arguments, ensuring proper argument handling ([b7a41d1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b7a41d15ea09acc2705de48ff0234b16143824d9))
- **Memory management improvement** introduces garbage collection compaction during parallel process execution to optimize memory usage ([b69aa45](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b69aa457a8c2b59954cee5cc1e924a7efedfec01))
- **Documentation enhancement** in manual adds version information for `avoid-version` and `deprecated` flags, clarifying when these features were introduced ([84a61fc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/84a61fce25f9cce07cd343b8b72085e10053872c))
- **Environment variable documentation fix** corrects reference from `OPAM_EDITOR` to `OPAMEDITOR` in pin command help text ([a499f1f](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/a499f1f533fc97806a785316bd6782a22f4a1c61))
repositories.activity_summary: One new PR opened for environment variable flag support, one issue reported for Windows path handling
repositories.activity:

- **Windows path handling issue** reported by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) regarding `/cygdrive` prefixes in PATH when using `opam env` in non-cygwin bash on Windows ([#6310](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6310))
- **Installation workflow improvement** remains under development with [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine)'s PR for running opam init during fresh installations, though this PR needs updates ([#5501](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5501))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on Windows compatibility improvements and environment variable handling enhancements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Windows compatibility focus** with active work on path handling improvements and environment variable processing for better cross-platform support
- **Environment variable enhancement** development targeting CI/CD integration, particularly GitHub Actions workflow improvements
- **Documentation maintenance** with continued efforts to clarify feature introduction timelines and correct technical references
repositories.contributors_summary: Stephen Sherratt reported Windows issues, R. Boujbel opened environment flag PR, multiple merged contributions
repositories.contributors:

- [@sabine](https://github.com/sabine) continues work on installation workflow improvements with ongoing PR for opam init automation ([#5501](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5501))
- [@kit-ty-kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) provided code review feedback on environment variable PR, suggesting improvements for flag naming and newline character handling ([#6316](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6316))
- [@dra27](https://github.com/dra27) provided technical analysis of Windows path issue, identifying root cause related to cygpath usage ([#6310](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6310))

repositories.brief_summary: Release week featuring 1.20.0 with new custom jump request, performance issue identification, and dependency updates
repositories.new_features_summary: Custom jump request API for Merlin-type code navigation and changelog preparation for 1.20.0 release
repositories.new_features:
- New **custom jump request API** `ocamllsp/jump` for Merlin-type code navigation allowing jumps to functions, matches, lets, modules, and match cases ([#1374](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1374))
- **Complete API specification** with TypeScript interfaces for `JumpParams` and `Jump` response types ([b363a353](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/b363a353b87c1a1aea4fe057ff1681fbe51c78ba))
- **Server capability registration** `handleJump` for advertising jump functionality to LSP clients ([b363a353](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/b363a353b87c1a1aea4fe057ff1681fbe51c78ba))
- **Comprehensive test suite** for jump functionality with various target types and edge cases ([b363a353](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/commit/b363a353b87c1a1aea4fe057ff1681fbe51c78ba))
- **Updated changelog** preparation for 1.20.0 release documenting new features and fixes ([#1408](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1408))
repositories.activity_summary: Two merged PRs bringing major navigation features, three opened PRs including dependency updates, and two new releases
repositories.activity:
- **New custom jump request implementation** merged by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) from [PixieDust](https://github.com/PizieDust)'s work providing Merlin-type code navigation capabilities ([#1374](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1374))
- **Release preparation** completed with changelog updates for version 1.20.0 by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) ([#1408](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1408))
- **Performance issue investigation** opened by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) identifying slow response times in Jump code actions affecting some projects ([#1410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1410))
- **Dependency maintenance** with [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) opening TypeScript updates from 5.4.5 to 5.7.2 ([#1407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1407)) and closing older update ([#1390](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1390))
- **OCaml 4.14 compatibility** prepared in separate branch for LTS version support ([#1409](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1409))
- **Stale PR cleanup** with old selection range improvements closed due to conflicts ([#860](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/860))
repositories.discussions_summary: Release coordination and package management discussions around version compatibility and opam solver behavior
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Release process coordination** with [Filipe Pina](https://github.com/fopina) requesting new release for URI fragments support and [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) confirming delivery ([#1406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1406))
- **Opam package management complexity** discussed by [Török Edwin](https://github.com/edwintorok) regarding version downgrades during upgrades, with detailed explanation of opam solver behavior from @kit-ty-kate ([#1405](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1405))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on LSP protocol extensions, backward compatibility, and performance optimization for production usage
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Custom LSP protocol extensions** gaining prominence with specialized requests like `ocamllsp/jump` providing editor-agnostic functionality beyond standard LSP
- **Performance-aware development** with proactive identification and deactivation of slow features like Jump code actions in favor of better custom request alternatives
- **Multi-version release strategy** maintaining compatibility with LTS OCaml versions (4.14) alongside current releases
- **Editor integration focus** with VSCode implementation ready alongside server-side custom request features
repositories.contributors_summary: Four active contributors with Ulysse leading releases, PixieDust implementing navigation features, and community reporting issues
repositories.contributors:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) led the release process with changelog preparation ([#1408](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1408)), merged the custom jump request implementation ([#1374](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1374)), identified performance issues with Jump code actions ([#1410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1410)), and prepared OCaml 4.14 compatibility branch ([#1409](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1409))
- [PixieDust](https://github.com/PizieDust) implemented the comprehensive custom jump request feature with full API specification, server capability registration, and test suite ([#1374](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1374))
- [Filipe Pina](https://github.com/fopina) engaged in release coordination discussions requesting new version for URI fragments support ([#1406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1406))
- [Török Edwin](https://github.com/edwintorok) reported and discussed opam package management issues regarding version constraint handling ([#1405](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1405))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) maintained project dependencies with TypeScript version updates ([#1407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1407), [#1390](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1390))

repositories.brief_summary: Merlin 5.3 release week with bug fixes for type-enclosing stability and occurrences handling plus new configuration features
repositories.new_features_summary: Type-enclosing deduplication fixes and improved occurrences handling for hidden source files
repositories.new_features:
- **Type-enclosing query stability** improvements by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) reverting overly aggressive deduplication that caused unstable results ([#1864](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1864))
- **Occurrences functionality** enhanced to work when definition sources are hidden or not found, improving robustness ([#1865](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1865))
- **Test reproduction** added for configuration issues with duplicate executable names ([#1868](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1868))
repositories.activity_summary: Release preparation activities with backporting and new configuration features proposed for .merlin file handling
repositories.activity:
- **New configuration feature** proposed by [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford) introducing `.merlin.skip-if-not-cwd` files to control configuration loading in subprojects ([#1870](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1870))
- **Release activities** by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) including backports for 4.18-414 release ([#1866](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1866)) and release preparation for merlin 5.3 ([ac951c6](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/commit/ac951c6))
- **Bug fix integration** completed with type-enclosing deduplication fixes ([#1864](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1864)) and occurrences improvements ([#1865](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1865)) merged into main branch
- **Test case development** by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) creating reproduction test for executable name prefix configuration bug ([#1868](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1868))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on configuration robustness and release quality with extensive test coverage for edge cases
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Configuration handling** improvements addressing complex project setups with mixed .merlin and dune-project configurations
- **Release quality** emphasis with comprehensive backporting and test case development for reported issues
- **Robustness improvements** in core functionality like occurrences and type-enclosing queries handling edge cases better
repositories.contributors_summary: Two contributors active: Ulysse leading development and releases, jonahbeckford proposing configuration enhancements
repositories.contributors:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) implemented type-enclosing stability fixes ([#1864](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1864)), occurrences improvements for hidden sources ([#1865](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1865)), created reproduction test ([#1868](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1868)), handled release backports ([#1866](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1866)), and managed release preparation activities
- [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford) opened feature request for unified .merlin file handling ([#1869](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1869)) and submitted PR for `.merlin.skip-if-not-cwd` configuration feature ([#1870](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1870))
- [@yannl35133](https://github.com/yannl35133) reported configuration bug regarding executable name conflicts affecting library information ([#1867](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1867))

repositories.brief_summary: Dune 3.17.0 release with major new features including wasm_of_ocaml support, Dune cache enabled by default, and package management improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: Package formatting environment fixes, code refactoring for dune fmt command, and trailing whitespace cleanup
repositories.new_features:
- **Package formatting environment** fixes ensuring correct environment usage for format rules in package management ([#11155](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11155), [c4634e3](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/c4634e31a117687f27c50225391678bd35bf2a0c))
- **Dune fmt command** refactoring to simplify code structure and improve maintainability ([#11156](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11156), [6212a17](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/6212a173e4c5b170147c82d1560145bd327f2cd7))
- **Code cleanup** removing trailing whitespace in README documentation ([#11154](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11154), [d9f5eb7](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/d9f5eb74b384f024d857a9400ba0e05b855f7e6a))
repositories.activity_summary: Major Dune 3.17.0 release published with comprehensive new features and Windows package management planning
repositories.activity:
- **Dune 3.17.0 release** published by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) featuring extensive new capabilities including wasm_of_ocaml support, Dune cache enabled by default, and enhanced JavaScript compilation control
- **Windows package management** initiative launched by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) with comprehensive tracking issue identifying 10+ specific areas requiring Windows support ([#11161](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11161))
- **New compiler flag support** for OCaml 5.2's `-H` flag enabling correct semantics for `(implicit_transitive_deps false)` in this release
- **Enhanced development tools** including individual test running with `dune runtest mytest.t`, Codeberg repository support, and project defaults configuration
- **Performance and usability** improvements with new cache settings, improved terminal color readability, and configurator enhancements
repositories.trends_summary: Focus shifting toward cross-platform compatibility and enhanced developer experience with package management improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform package management** becoming a priority with dedicated Windows support initiative tracking multiple related issues and binary distribution requirements
- **Enhanced developer tooling** with new testing capabilities, configuration options, and improved integration with external tools like wasm_of_ocaml
- **Default behavior modernization** including enabling Dune cache by default and updating project initialization to reflect current best practices
repositories.contributors_summary: Etienne led the 3.17.0 release while Stephen Sherratt opened Windows package management planning issue
repositories.contributors:
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) published both the 3.17.0 alpha and final releases, coordinating the delivery of major new features including wasm_of_ocaml support and default cache enablement
- [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) opened comprehensive Windows package management tracking issue ([#11161](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11161)) identifying specific areas requiring development across multiple repositories

repositories.brief_summary: Three new GC improvement proposals opened by Christophe Raffalli, with ongoing discussions on types as module arguments
repositories.activity_summary: Three new GC proposals opened plus continued refinement discussions on types as module arguments proposal
repositories.activity:
- Three **new GC proposal PRs opened** by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) exploring garbage collector improvements, though two were immediately closed due to technical issues and replaced ([#48](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/48), [#49](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/49), [#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
- **Types as module arguments proposal** by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) continued with detailed technical discussions about value restriction and type escaping scope, with contributions from [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) and [Didier Remy](https://github.com/diremy) on implementation strategy ([#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical discussions on GC aging approaches and value restriction strategies for type parameters
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **GC optimization discussion** between [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) and [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) about aging approaches in garbage collection, with historical context on why book-keeping dominated performance improvements in past implementations ([#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
- **Value restriction strategy debate** for types as module arguments, with [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) proposing a two-step approach using strict value restriction initially, then potentially relaxing to weak value restriction later to handle type escaping scenarios ([#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
repositories.contributors_summary: Christophe Raffalli submitted GC proposals, Samuel Vivien advanced module system design, with review input from Leo White, Damien Doligez, Gabriel Scherer, and Didier Remy
repositories.contributors:
- [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) opened three PR attempts for GC improvements, iterating through technical issues to arrive at a clean proposal ([#48](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/48), [#49](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/49), [#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
- [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) continued refining the types as module arguments proposal with detailed analysis of value restriction challenges and proposed implementation strategy ([#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
- [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) provided historical context and technical feedback on GC aging approaches, referencing past implementation experience ([#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) contributed guidance on the phased approach to implementing type parameters with value restriction ([#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
- [Didier Remy](https://github.com/diremy) engaged in detailed technical discussion about type abstraction and module evaluation semantics ([#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
- [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) referenced in discussions about GC implementation approaches ([#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))

repositories.brief_summary: Major cookbook expansion with new networking and XML recipes, OCaml 5.3.0-beta2 changelog, and tutorial fixes
repositories.new_features_summary: Cookbook task descriptions now render as markdown, new networking and XML cookbook sections, enhanced UTF-8 recipes
repositories.new_features:
- **Cookbook task descriptions** now render as markdown to allow links, improving navigation and documentation ([#2832](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2832))
- New **networking cookbook section** with TCP client and server recipes using Lwt ([#2400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2400))
- New **XML cookbook section** with parse and generate recipes using ezxmlm ([#2401](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2401))
- New **HTTP GET request cookbook recipe** with cohttp-lwt-unix implementation ([#2402](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2402))
- Enhanced **timeout with promises cookbook recipe** supporting both Lwt and Async ([#2584](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2584))
- Enhanced **UTF-8 text processing cookbook recipe** with comprehensive character handling examples ([#2379](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2379))
- New **basic concurrency cookbook recipe** demonstrating promise creation and await patterns ([#2377](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2377))
- **OCaml 5.3.0-beta2 changelog** published with latest release information ([#2837](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2837))
- Fixed **type signature in Basic Datatypes tutorial** improving accuracy of educational content ([#2843](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2843))
- Fixed **identity function code example** in tutorial documentation ([#2842](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2842))
repositories.activity_summary: Active cookbook development and content curation with improved organization and new OCaml Planet blog posts
repositories.activity:

repositories.brief_summary: Governance documentation added, major package releases for Dune 3.17.0, cohttp 6.0.0, eio 1.2, OCaml 5.3.0~beta2, and emergency fix for broken color package
repositories.new_features_summary: Governance documentation, archiving policies, Dune 3.17.0 build system features, cohttp 6.0.0 HTTP client improvements, eio 1.2 async I/O enhancements
repositories.new_features:

- **cohttp 6.0.0 HTTP library** major release with 12 packages covering async, lwt, eio, curl backends and breaking changes requiring dependency updates ([f83c066](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/f83c066b82d2cc921f725d5ad7c8b3df17ee1c1a))

- **Package deprecation markings** for Solo5 and OCaml freestanding packages indicating ecosystem evolution ([fa3a05e](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/fa3a05eb9f696a9d0a5576b7c4e6007a1ee935fd))
repositories.activity_summary: Emergency response to broken color package, extensive cohttp 6.0 compatibility updates, major package releases, and modernization of build tools
repositories.activity:
- **Emergency package fix** handled by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) reverting broken color.0.3.0 release that broke repository CI with parse errors ([#26956](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26956), [23989dd](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/23989dd843df067e55630bf472e05927bba4a558))
- **cohttp 6.0.0 ecosystem migration** with extensive compatibility updates across multiple packages by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) and [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) including upper bounds for caldav, graphql-cohttp, websocket-async, and other HTTP-dependent packages ([#26925](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26925), [#26969](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26969), [#26950](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26950))
- **Merlin editor support** updated by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) with versions 4.18-414 and 5.3-502 for different OCaml compiler compatibility ([#26965](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26965))
- **Package deprecation initiative** by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) marking Solo5 and OCaml freestanding packages as deprecated while updating RML packages for OCaml 5 compatibility ([#27001](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27001), [#27000](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27000), [#26997](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26997))
- **New package releases** including postgresql 5.1.1, gsl 1.25.1, elpi 2.0.2-2.0.4, capnp-rpc 1.2.4, carbon 0.2.0, passage 0.1.5-0.1.6, and many others by various contributors
- **Archive URL updates** by [@hirrolot](https://github.com/hirrolot) for mazeppa and checked_oint packages ensuring stable source availability ([#26958](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26958), [#26966](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26966))
repositories.discussions_summary: Key discussion on CI linting integration and repository breakage prevention mechanisms
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **CI linting integration proposal** by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) to integrate opam-repo-ci checks into dune-release and opam publish tools, aiming to catch package issues before submission rather than during CI ([#26959](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26959))
- **Repository breakage analysis** following the color package incident, with discussions between [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder), [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS), and [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) about strict mode usage in CI and prevention mechanisms ([#26956](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26956))
repositories.trends_summary: Ecosystem consolidation around modern OCaml versions, governance formalization, and proactive quality assurance integration
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Governance formalization** with the introduction of comprehensive repository policies and archiving procedures, establishing clear criteria for package inclusion and maintenance expectations
- **Quality assurance modernization** through integration of CI linting tools into publication workflows, shifting validation earlier in the development lifecycle to reduce manual review overhead
- **Legacy package deprecation** with systematic marking of outdated Solo5 and OCaml freestanding packages, reflecting ecosystem evolution toward modern alternatives
- **Major version coordination** with synchronized releases of core ecosystem packages (Dune, cohttp, eio) requiring extensive compatibility testing and dependency updates across the package ecosystem

repositories.brief_summary: Major WebAssembly backend merge with enhanced DOM HTML API improvements and documentation updates
repositories.new_features_summary: WebAssembly backend integration, enhanced DOM scroll and mouse event APIs, improved JavaScript number type handling
repositories.new_features:
- **Complete WebAssembly backend integration** from ocaml-wasm fork with new `wasm_of_ocaml` compiler supporting GC extension, tail-call extension, and exception handling ([e83dd90de8ac200376bea9a1f687812d3452f587](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/e83dd90de8ac200376bea9a1f687812d3452f587))
- **Enhanced DOM HTML APIs** with new window scroll properties `scrollX` and `scrollY` plus `scrollTop` method ([094d528d711e51a89e13ddc5efb153758700130b](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/094d528d711e51a89e13ddc5efb153758700130b))
- **Improved mouse and touch event type safety** with properties now correctly typed as numbers instead of integers following CSSOM specification ([129bcb85891dfada4b6e89b1aba16342acc1ef42](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/129bcb85891dfada4b6e89b1aba16342acc1ef42))
- **Updated JavaScript number type handling** with `number_t` now properly defined as `number t` and improved type consistency across string methods ([lib/js_of_ocaml/js.ml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/e83dd90de8ac200376bea9a1f687812d3452f587))
- **Scroll properties standardization** with `scrollLeft` and `scrollTop` now correctly typed as numbers per CSSOM specification ([83ee0007f2284a15d99f985fc5ba3a5e377fb662](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/83ee0007f2284a15d99f985fc5ba3a5e377fb662))
repositories.activity_summary: New PR opened for physical equality hints while major WebAssembly work was merged from ocaml-wasm fork
repositories.activity:
- **New PR opened** for physical equality hints by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) addressing issue #1372 but currently in draft status with merge conflicts ([#1745](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1745))
- **Major WebAssembly backend merge** completed with massive integration from ocaml-wasm fork bringing complete WASM compilation support including 31,000+ lines of new code across 280+ files
- **Documentation requirements clarification** issue opened by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) requesting documentation of minimal Node.js version 16 and ECMAScript feature requirements ([#1750](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1750))
- **Release 5.9 preparation** merged with version bumps and CI improvements including opam constraint adjustments and macOS CI fixes
repositories.trends_summary: Strong focus on WebAssembly integration and DOM API standardization compliance
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **WebAssembly backend maturation** with comprehensive runtime implementation, support for OCaml 5.x effect handlers, and compatibility with modern browsers requiring cutting-edge WASM extensions
- **DOM API specification compliance** with systematic updates to match current web standards, particularly around CSSOM view specification for scroll and mouse event properties
- **Cross-compiler compatibility** work ensuring shared codebase between JavaScript and WebAssembly backends with proper value representation handling
repositories.contributors_summary: Single active contributor with documentation and feature work
repositories.contributors: - [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) opened new documentation requirements issue ([#1750](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1750)) and submitted draft PR for physical equality hints ([#1745](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1745)) addressing long-standing optimization needs

repositories.brief_summary: Week featured new template instantiation features, major capsule API enhancements, and extensive CFG backend refactoring work
repositories.new_features_summary: Added `-instantiate` command line flag for templates, enhanced capsule API with new Access module and converters
repositories.new_features:
- New **`-instantiate` command line flag** for template compilation allowing instantiation of templates with arguments from remaining files ([#1905](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/1905))
- **Enhanced capsule API** with new `Access.t` module providing wrapping and unwrapping of `Data.t` values, replacing password-based access patterns ([#3161](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3161))
- Added **shared password support** in capsule API through `Password.Shared.t` for shared access to capsules ([#3161](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3161))
- New **`access` and `access_shared` functions** for running code within capsules with proper access control ([#3161](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3161))
- **Updated capsule API converters** including `wrap`, `unwrap`, and `unwrap_shared` functions for managing capsule data ([#3161](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3161))
- **Version bump to 5.2.0minus-4** with updated magic numbers for bytecode and native code compilation ([#3325](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3325))
- Added **`.git-blame-ignore-revs` file** to ignore formatting commits in git blame output ([#3277](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3277))
repositories.activity_summary: Extensive CFG backend refactoring with new modules and performance improvements, plus CI infrastructure updates
repositories.activity:
- **CFG backend restructuring** with extraction of common elements into dedicated modules including new `cfgize_utils.ml` and `polling_utils.ml` modules ([#3294](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3294), [#3295](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3295))
- **CFG selection improvements** including avoidance of polymorphic compare operations ([#3314](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3314)), removal of debugging statements ([#3313](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3313)), and fixes to trywith expression handling ([#3312](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3312))
- **New Sub_cfg module** extracted to handle sub-control flow graph operations ([#3322](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3322))
- **Performance optimization** for `flush_delayed_lets` function when processing large expressions ([#3315](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3315))
- **Build and CI infrastructure** updates including migration from macos-12 to macos-latest ([#3308](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3308)) and macOS CI tweaks ([#3320](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3320))
- **Unique barrier creation** now controlled by a dedicated flag ([#3271](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3271))
- **Code quality improvements** with "contains calls" judgement moved to cfg.ml ([#3323](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3323)) and fixes to Terminator case in emit_tail_apply ([#3324](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3324))
- **Test infrastructure** fixes including backtrace test with embedded line numbers from compiler ([#3087](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3087))
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical discussion on allocation optimization in imperative loops with Flambda2 compiler
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Imperative loop allocation optimization** discussion by [Patrick Nicodemus](https://github.com/patrick-nicodemus) regarding local allocation in loops using Flambda2 bleeding edge compiler ([#3293](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3293))
- **Floating point dependency optimization** technical discussion between [Pierre Chambart](https://github.com/chambart) and [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) about breaking false dependencies in x86 SSE instructions ([#3293](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3293))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on modularization and code organization with extensive CFG backend refactoring and API standardization
repositories.emerging_trends:

- **API standardization** through comprehensive redesign of the capsule API to provide more consistent and type-safe access patterns
- **Performance-focused development** with targeted optimizations for large expression handling and memory allocation patterns
- **Infrastructure modernization** including CI updates and improved developer tooling with git blame ignore files
repositories.contributors_summary: Multiple contributors worked on CFG backend improvements, template features, and infrastructure updates
repositories.contributors:

- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) closed the unboxed product arrays issue ([#3218](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3218))
- [Pierre Chambart](https://github.com/chambart) provided technical insights on compiler dependency breaking and processor-level optimizations ([#3293](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3293))
- [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) contributed detailed analysis of x86 SSE instruction dependencies and register handling for floating point operations ([#3293](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3293))

repositories.brief_summary: Integration of OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 compiler changes with jkind printing improvements and modal module syntax updates

- **Parse tree** improvements with module type functor mode annotations and named parameter mode support ([d82f23a](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/d82f23ac5c18a629588f590c7519a947e35d636b))
repositories.activity_summary: Major compiler integration work merging OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 with extensive testing and conflict resolution

- **Type system updates** across 143 files affecting jkind handling, modal modules, and AST representations with particular focus on printing and conversion logic ([aabad19](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/aabad19cce2bb3f354d87158e904c9f2a6a5cdab) through [30323e1](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/30323e198474d2068e4714977513f6ddb0713476))

repositories.discussions_summary: Technical discussions focused on modal module semantics and jkind annotation correctness

- **Jkind printing** review coordination with [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) for type declaration annotations and constructor argument handling to ensure proper integration with new compiler changes ([#120](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/120))

repositories.contributors_summary: Single major contribution from Liam Stevenson with review coordination from OCaml type system experts

repositories.contributors_summary: Two contributors involved in issue resolution
repositories.contributors:
- [Krzysztof Leśniak](https://github.com/serpent7776) reported a debugging issue with a long-running program experiencing a hang in the io_uring library ([#119](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/issues/119))

repositories.brief_summary: Maintenance week focused on fixing js_of_ocaml compatibility and upgrading cohttp dependency to stable release
repositories.new_features_summary: Improved js_of_ocaml compatibility and cohttp integration with API adjustments
repositories.new_features:
- Fixed **js_of_ocaml compatibility** by removing reference to `caml_ml_domain_id` on OCaml 4 to resolve breakage with js_of_ocaml 5.9.0 ([#333](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/333))
- **Cohttp 6.0.0 upgrade** with API adjustments removing deprecated `flush` parameter from response functions ([#335](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/335))
- Enhanced **test suite** with separate Run module tests and improved js_of_ocaml test compatibility ([a8b3a85](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/commit/a8b3a85c40eb405d5f62b24df81c57c249fca089), [3d354d6](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/commit/3d354d6225c900146665d60e7f8d848127045fb5))
repositories.activity_summary: Three PRs merged addressing compatibility issues plus one draft PR for structured Run operations
repositories.activity:
- **Draft PR opened** for structured Run operations by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) with significant API additions ([#334](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/334))
- **js_of_ocaml compatibility** restored through fix for `caml_ml_domain_id` reference issue reported by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) and resolved by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) ([#332](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/332), [#333](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/333))
- **Cohttp dependency upgrade** completed from beta to stable 6.0.0 release with corresponding API adjustments ([#335](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/335))
- **OpenBSD compatibility** PR closed as no longer needed due to OCaml-CI infrastructure improvements ([#331](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/331))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on external compatibility and dependency maintenance rather than new feature development
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **External compatibility maintenance** taking priority with fixes for js_of_ocaml and cohttp dependency updates
- **Infrastructure resilience** demonstrated by OCaml-CI improvements eliminating need for platform-specific workarounds
- **API evolution** continuing with structured concurrency operations in development ([#334](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/334))
repositories.contributors_summary: Vesa Karvonen handled all merged PRs while hhugo reported the js_of_ocaml compatibility issue
repositories.contributors:
- [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) implemented js_of_ocaml compatibility fix ([#333](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/333)), upgraded cohttp dependency ([#335](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/335)), improved test organization, and opened draft PR for structured Run operations ([#334](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/334))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) identified and reported the js_of_ocaml breakage affecting picos.thread on OCaml < 5 with proposed solution ([#332](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/332))

repositories.brief_summary: Week focused on Saturn 1.0 release preparation with documentation improvements and new data structures
repositories.activity_summary: Five new PRs opened for Saturn 1.0 release preparation including documentation updates and new features
repositories.activity:
- **Five new PRs opened** this week including lockfree bag implementation by [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) ([#173](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/173)), skiplist documentation improvements ([#172](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/172)), README file updates ([#169](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/169)), useful warnings additions ([#170](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/170)), and work stealing deque updates ([#168](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/168))
- **Saturn 1.0 release preparation** reached completion with [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) closing the progress tracking issue ([#123](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/123)) and announcing release for beginning of next week
- **Documentation improvements** delivered across multiple data structures including Michael Scott queue uniformization ([#167](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/167)) and SPSC queue standardization ([#165](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/165))
- **Issue closure activity** with multiple historical issues resolved including examples addition ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/57)), bounded data structures request ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/52)), OCaml version recommendation update ([#95](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/95)), skiplist implementation rejection ([#87](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/87)), kcas_data import cancellation ([#93](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/93)), and linearizability documentation issue ([#132](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/132))
repositories.discussions_summary: Discussion on copy_as_padded performance impact and Saturn queue interface consistency
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Performance optimization discussion** opened by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) regarding the impact of `copy_as_padded` usage across data structures and potential memory overhead in real applications ([#171](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/171))
- **API design discussion** continued by [Shuntian Liu](https://github.com/Vincent-lau) and [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) about Saturn.Queue.push interface consistency across data structures, with detailed response explaining design rationale for placing data structure as first argument ([#149](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/149))
repositories.trends_summary: Strong focus on release preparation with comprehensive documentation standardization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Release readiness focus** with comprehensive closure of outstanding issues and documentation standardization across all data structures as Saturn approaches 1.0 release
- **Documentation standardization** pattern emerging with consistent API documentation, examples, and testing approaches being applied systematically across different data structures
- **Performance optimization awareness** with community discussions about memory usage patterns and optimization trade-offs in concurrent data structures
repositories.contributors_summary: Primary development by Carine Morel with community feedback from art-w and user questions
repositories.contributors:
- [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) led development activity with five PR creations ([#173](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/173), [#172](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/172), [#169](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/169), [#170](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/170), [#168](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/168)), managed release preparation by closing the Saturn 1.0 progress tracking issue ([#123](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/123)), and provided detailed responses to community questions about API design choices ([#149](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/149))
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) contributed through performance-focused issue creation about `copy_as_padded` usage patterns ([#171](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/171)) and provided code review feedback on multiple PRs
- [Shuntian Liu](https://github.com/Vincent-lau) engaged in API design discussion about Saturn queue interface consistency ([#149](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/149))
- [François Bérenger](https://github.com/UnixJunkie) received closure notification for long-standing bounded data structures request ([#52](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/52))
- [Török Edwin](https://github.com/edwintorok) had linearizability documentation issue resolved ([#132](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/132))
- [KC Sivaramakrishnan](https://github.com/kayceesrk) received confirmation of OCaml version recommendation update ([#95](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/95))
