repositories.brief_summary: Fixed fiber display timing bug affecting fibers that end before suspend operations
repositories.new_features_summary: Fixed fiber lifetime tracking bug in tracing visualization affecting end times
repositories.new_features: - Fixed **fiber lifetime tracking** bug where fibers ending before a suspend operation would incorrectly appear to remain active until domain resume, improving trace visualization accuracy ([#44](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace/issues/44))
repositories.activity_summary: Single PR merged fixing fiber display timing issue in trace visualization
repositories.activity: - **Fiber display bug fix** merged by [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) addressing incorrect lifetime extension of ended fibers during domain switches ([#44](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace/issues/44))
repositories.contributors_summary: Thomas Leonard implemented and merged the fiber display timing fix
repositories.contributors: - [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) implemented the fiber lifetime tracking fix by adding a conditional check to only record pause events for fibers that haven't already ended, preventing incorrect timeline display in trace visualization ([#44](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace/issues/44))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Governance framework established, major package releases coordinated, and cookbook documentation significantly expanded
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Repository governance policies, Dune 3.17.0, cohttp 6.0.0, eio 1.2, OCaml 5.3.0~beta2, cookbook markdown rendering, networking and XML recipes
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Repository governance framework** established with comprehensive policies covering package inclusion criteria, archiving procedures, and maintenance guidelines ([ocaml/opam-repository@9f34991](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/9f34991c038ca38ca54a43232b9cae1c14a3f1e3))
- **Archiving policy documentation** with criteria for package removal and migration to archive repository with OCaml 4.08 compiler cutoff threshold ([ocaml/opam-repository@3947397](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/3947397ce3a2c5f039a8e0ea1acc1086a2fb87ec))
- **Dune 3.17.0 build system** released with 15 packages including enhanced configurator, action plugins, and RPC support ([ocaml/opam-repository@ca0426d](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/ca0426d054f04f4bbc8a22a66a604a5d71ccb3d6))
- **cohttp 6.0.0 HTTP library** major release with 12 packages covering async, lwt, eio, curl backends and breaking changes ([ocaml/opam-repository@f83c066](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/f83c066b82d2cc921f725d5ad7c8b3df17ee1c1a))
- **eio 1.2 async I/O framework** with improved Linux, POSIX, and Windows backends ([ocaml/opam-repository@11a8f00](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/11a8f002396991d2c7d9b568985bab39d5da98a0))
- **OCaml 5.3.0~beta2 compiler** pre-release with base compiler and variants packages ([ocaml/opam-repository@56fb28d](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/56fb28ded62d331d0760c279b2f8a84cf94e35b6))
- **Cookbook task descriptions** now render as markdown to allow links, improving navigation and documentation ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2832](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2832))
- **Networking cookbook section** with TCP client and server recipes using Lwt ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2400))
- **XML cookbook section** with parse and generate recipes using ezxmlm ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2401](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2401))
- **HTTP GET request cookbook recipe** with cohttp-lwt-unix implementation ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2402](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2402))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Package ecosystem management** saw major activity with governance documentation introduction, archiving policies, and emergency response to package breakage
- **Major releases coordination** across core ecosystem packages including Dune 3.17.0, cohttp 6.0.0, eio 1.2, and OCaml 5.3.0~beta2 requiring extensive compatibility testing
- **Documentation and learning resources** expansion through cookbook development with new networking, XML processing, and concurrency recipes
- **Quality assurance initiatives** including CI linting integration proposals and proactive package validation mechanisms
- **Legacy package management** with systematic deprecation of outdated packages and modernization of build tools
group_summaries.activity_summary: Emergency package fixes, extensive cohttp compatibility updates, cookbook content expansion, and tutorial improvements
group_summaries.activity:
- **Emergency response** handled by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) reverting broken color.0.3.0 release that broke repository CI ([ocaml/opam-repository#26956](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26956))
- **Ecosystem migration support** for cohttp 6.0.0 with extensive compatibility updates across multiple packages by [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) and [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) ([ocaml/opam-repository#26925](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26925), [ocaml/opam-repository#26969](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26969))
- **Package deprecation initiative** by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) marking Solo5 and OCaml freestanding packages as deprecated ([ocaml/opam-repository#27001](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27001), [ocaml/opam-repository#27000](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27000))
- **Cookbook content expansion** delivered through multiple merged PRs including networking, XML processing, HTTP requests, and concurrency patterns ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2400), [ocaml/ocaml.org#2401](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2401), [ocaml/ocaml.org#2402](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2402))
- **Tutorial documentation improvements** with fixed type signatures and code examples enhancing learning resources ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2842](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2842), [ocaml/ocaml.org#2843](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2843))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **OCaml 5.3.0~beta2 release coordination** with package availability in [ocaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository) ([ocaml/opam-repository#26989](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26989)) and changelog publication on [ocaml/ocaml.org](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org) ([ocaml/ocaml.org#2837](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2837))
- **HTTP ecosystem documentation alignment** with cohttp 6.0.0 package release and cookbook recipes demonstrating HTTP client usage with cohttp-lwt-unix ([ocaml/opam-repository#26925](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26925), [ocaml/ocaml.org#2402](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2402))
- **Package quality initiatives** spanning repository governance documentation and educational content improvements to support package maintainers and users across both repositories
- **Community contributions** from [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) and [@octachron](https://github.com/octachron) working on both package releases and documentation updates
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **CI linting integration proposal** by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) to integrate opam-repo-ci checks into dune-release and opam publish tools, aiming to catch package issues before submission rather than during CI ([ocaml/opam-repository#26959](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26959))
- **Repository breakage analysis** following the color package incident, with discussions about strict mode usage in CI and prevention mechanisms ([ocaml/opam-repository#26956](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26956))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Governance formalization** across the ecosystem with comprehensive repository policies and archiving procedures establishing clear criteria for package inclusion and maintenance
- **Quality assurance modernization** through integration of CI linting tools into publication workflows, shifting validation earlier in the development lifecycle
- **Educational content enhancement** with markdown rendering capabilities and expanded cookbook recipes focusing on practical networking and web development patterns
- **Major version coordination** requiring synchronized releases and extensive compatibility testing across the package ecosystem
- **Legacy technology deprecation** with systematic marking of outdated packages reflecting ecosystem evolution toward modern alternatives

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major release week with Dune 3.17.0, Merlin 5.3, OCaml-LSP 1.20.0, and comprehensive WebAssembly backend integration
group_summaries.new_features_summary: WebAssembly backend, custom LSP jump navigation, type-enclosing stability fixes, package formatting improvements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **WebAssembly backend integration** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) bringing complete `wasm_of_ocaml` compiler with GC, tail-call extensions, and exception handling ([e83dd90](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/e83dd90de8ac200376bea9a1f687812d3452f587))
- **Custom jump request API** in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) providing `ocamllsp/jump` for Merlin-type code navigation to functions, matches, lets, and modules ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1374](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1374))
- **Enhanced DOM APIs** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with scroll properties `scrollX`, `scrollY`, and improved mouse event type safety ([094d528](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/094d528d711e51a89e13ddc5efb153758700130b))
- **Type-enclosing query stability** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) reverting aggressive deduplication that caused unstable results ([ocaml/merlin#1864](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1864))
- **Package formatting environment fixes** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ensuring correct environment usage for format rules ([ocaml/dune#11155](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11155))
- **Pin command enhancement** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) displaying repository revision information for version control sources ([b2a4da8](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b2a4da8bc32da72c27ba9baa03cc70296de52f51))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Three major releases** delivered: [Dune 3.17.0](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with wasm_of_ocaml support and default cache enablement, [Merlin 5.3](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with stability fixes, and [OCaml-LSP 1.20.0](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) with custom navigation features
- **WebAssembly integration milestone** achieved with complete backend merge from ocaml-wasm fork into [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) enabling modern browser WASM compilation
- **Cross-platform compatibility initiative** launched with coordinated Windows support planning across [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) repositories
- **Editor tooling advancement** with new LSP protocol extensions and improved configuration handling for complex project setups
group_summaries.activity_summary: Release coordination activities, Windows compatibility planning, and documentation improvements across multiple repositories
group_summaries.activity:
- **Coordinated release activities** with [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) publishing [ocaml/dune#3.17.0](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) managing [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) releases with comprehensive changelog preparation
- **Cross-repository backporting** by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) handling [ocaml/merlin#1866](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1866) for 4.18-414 compatibility and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1409](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1409) for OCaml 4.14 LTS support
- **Configuration enhancement proposals** including [.merlin.skip-if-not-cwd](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1870) files by [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford) and environment variable flag development by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) for GitHub Actions integration
- **Documentation quality improvements** with Node.js version requirements clarification in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1750](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1750) and manual updates in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) for feature timeline documentation
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Windows package management coordination** between [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) opening comprehensive tracking issue [ocaml/dune#11161](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11161) and reporting path handling issues [ocaml/opam#6310](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6310)
- **WebAssembly compilation pipeline** integration between [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) 3.17.0 release featuring wasm_of_ocaml support and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) delivering the complete WebAssembly backend
- **LSP and Merlin coordination** with [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) implementing custom jump requests that complement [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) type-enclosing improvements for enhanced editor navigation
- **Release timing coordination** across toolchain with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune), [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin), and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) all delivering major versions within the same week
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Opam package management complexity** discussion by [Török Edwin](https://github.com/edwintorok) in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1405](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1405) regarding version downgrades during upgrades with detailed solver behavior explanation from [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)
- **Release coordination** discussion between [Filipe Pina](https://github.com/fopina) and [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1406) for URI fragments support delivery timing
- **Performance optimization** identification by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1410) regarding slow Jump code actions affecting project responsiveness
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform tooling maturation** with coordinated Windows support development spanning [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) package management and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) environment handling improvements
- **WebAssembly ecosystem integration** with [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) delivering production-ready WASM backend and [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) providing compilation support
- **LSP protocol extension development** with [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) implementing custom requests like `ocamllsp/jump` for editor-agnostic functionality beyond standard LSP capabilities
- **Release quality emphasis** with comprehensive backporting, test coverage improvements, and multi-version compatibility strategies across [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp)
- **Configuration robustness improvements** addressing complex project setups with mixed .merlin and dune-project configurations for better developer experience

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major week with template instantiation features, capsule API enhancements, CFG backend refactoring, and OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 integration
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Template instantiation flag, enhanced capsule API with Access module, modal module syntax support, and jkind printing improvements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Template instantiation** via new `-instantiate` command line flag in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) allowing template compilation with arguments from remaining files ([oxcaml/oxcaml#1905](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/1905))
- **Enhanced capsule API** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with new `Access.t` module providing wrapping and unwrapping of `Data.t` values, replacing password-based access patterns ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3161](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3161))
- **Shared password support** in capsule API through `Password.Shared.t` for shared access to capsules with new `access` and `access_shared` functions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3161](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3161))
- **Modal module syntax** support in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with functor parameter mode annotations and module type constraints ([oxcaml/merlin#120](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/120))
- **Jkind printing logic** improvements in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with cleaner user-written annotation handling in type declarations ([oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/30323e198474d2068e4714977513f6ddb0713476))
- **Version bump to 5.2.0minus-4** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with updated magic numbers for bytecode and native code compilation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3325](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3325))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Primary activity** concentrated in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with template instantiation features, capsule API enhancements, and extensive CFG backend refactoring work
- **Compiler integration** work in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 integration including modal module syntax and jkind printing improvements
- **Single issue** reported in [janestreet/opam-repository](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository) regarding odoc compilation failure with OCaml compiler variants
- **No activity** recorded in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) and [oxcaml/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/js_of_ocaml) during this period
group_summaries.activity_summary: CFG backend restructuring with new utility modules, compiler integration across 143 files, and performance optimizations
group_summaries.activity:
- **CFG backend restructuring** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with extraction of common elements into dedicated modules including new `cfgize_utils.ml` and `polling_utils.ml` modules ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3294](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3294), [oxcaml/oxcaml#3295](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3295))
- **Sub_cfg module** extraction in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) to handle sub-control flow graph operations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3322](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3322))
- **Performance optimization** for `flush_delayed_lets` function when processing large expressions in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3315](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3315))
- **Compiler integration** from OCaml flambda-backend version 5.2.0minus-4 in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) affecting 143 files with comprehensive conflict resolution ([oxcaml/merlin#120](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/120))
- **Build infrastructure** updates in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) including migration from macos-12 to macos-latest ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3308](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3308)) and macOS CI tweaks ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3320](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3320))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **OCaml 5.2.0minus-4 coordination** between [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with synchronized version bumps and magic number updates ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3325](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3325), [oxcaml/merlin#120](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/120))
- **Compilation compatibility** issue affecting [janestreet/opam-repository](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository) where odoc package fails with OCaml variants.5.2.0+flambda2 compiler ([janestreet/opam-repository#35](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/35))
- **Type system integration** work spanning both repositories with jkind handling and modal programming features reflecting coordinated OCaml development efforts
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Imperative loop allocation optimization** discussion by [Patrick Nicodemus](https://github.com/patrick-nicodemus) in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) regarding local allocation in loops using Flambda2 bleeding edge compiler ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3293](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3293))
- **Floating point dependency optimization** technical discussion between [Pierre Chambart](https://github.com/chambart) and [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) about breaking false dependencies in x86 SSE instructions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3293](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3293))
- **Modal module semantics** discussion in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) between [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) regarding empty mode list handling, confirming syntax-only implementation without typedtree semantics ([oxcaml/merlin#120](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/120))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Modularization focus** with systematic extraction of common functionality into dedicated utility modules across the CFG backend in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml)
- **Type system modernization** emphasis on jkind and modal programming features reflecting OCaml's advanced type system development direction across [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin)
- **Compiler synchronization** pattern with systematic import of upstream OCaml flambda-backend changes showing regular integration workflow between repositories
- **Performance-focused development** with targeted optimizations for large expression handling and memory allocation patterns in compiler backends

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major compiler improvements and three new GC proposals with significant warning system enhancements and ongoing type system discussions
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Enhanced warning messages, improved string parsing, Format module safety, and symbol name mangling updates
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Warning and alert message formatting** completely redesigned with composable formatting system in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml), improving error presentation and command-line output styling ([5a5eb48](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5a5eb481c7a9d0f039e3169aa8ed19c9b926e982))
- **String delimiter parsing** enhanced in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) to accept extended UTF-8 delimiter characters in quoted strings (`{delim||delim}`), improving Unicode support ([5a5eb48](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5a5eb481c7a9d0f039e3169aa8ed19c9b926e982))
- **Format module safety** improved in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with `Queue.take_opt` to prevent exceptions during concurrent access for multi-domain usage ([5a5eb48](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5a5eb481c7a9d0f039e3169aa8ed19c9b926e982))
- **Symbol name mangling** updated in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) to use `$` instead of `.` for module separation and `$$xx` encoding for special characters, providing consistent cross-platform identifier encoding ([703ba8e](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/703ba8eac4da669f793d84452a6137f333254db2))
- **Exception and type extension locations** now include location information in AST nodes in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) for better error reporting and tooling support ([5a5eb48](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5a5eb481c7a9d0f039e3169aa8ed19c9b926e982))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) delivered major compiler improvements with warning system redesign, garbage collection performance optimizations, and GADT type checking enhancements
- [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) saw three new garbage collection improvement proposals by [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) and continued technical discussions on types as module arguments ([ocaml/RFCs#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) and [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) contributed significant garbage collection performance improvements to [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with mark-delay optimization and shared heap enhancements ([ocaml/ocaml#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580), [ocaml/ocaml#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616))
- [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) worked on frame pointer improvements and symbol name mangling updates in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) ([ocaml/ocaml#13639](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13639), [ocaml/ocaml#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13050))
group_summaries.activity_summary: Extensive compiler internals work with GADT fixes, pattern matching improvements, and major runtime system enhancements
group_summaries.activity:
- **GADT type checking enhancements** merged in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with backtracking in `Ctype.unify_gadt` and optimized unification for better type inference ([ocaml/ocaml#13585](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13585))
- **Frame pointer handling** fixes and amd64 assembly refactoring in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) for better debugging support by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([ocaml/ocaml#13639](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13639), [ocaml/ocaml#13050](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13050))
- **Runtime system improvements** in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) including mangling fixes for `caml_system$frametable` and TSan oracle updates ([ocaml/ocaml#13650](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13650), [ocaml/ocaml#13642](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13642))
- **Pattern matching compiler** fixes in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) for GADT cases and protection of retyping functions to resolve warning 56 false positives ([ocaml/ocaml#13600](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13600), [ocaml/ocaml#13598](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13598))
- **Types as module arguments proposal** continued refinement in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) with detailed technical discussions about value restriction and type escaping scope ([ocaml/RFCs#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Garbage collection improvements** emerged as a shared theme with [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff) proposing three RFC improvements in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) ([ocaml/RFCs#48](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/48), [ocaml/RFCs#49](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/49), [ocaml/RFCs#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50)) while [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) and [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) implemented major GC performance optimizations in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) ([ocaml/ocaml#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580), [ocaml/ocaml#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616))
- **Type system development** coordinated between repositories with theoretical discussions on types as module arguments in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) ([ocaml/RFCs#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40)) and practical GADT type checking improvements implemented in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) ([ocaml/ocaml#13585](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13585))
- **Performance optimization focus** unified both repositories with [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) providing historical context on GC aging approaches in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) ([ocaml/RFCs#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50)) while concrete runtime improvements were merged in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml)
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **GC optimization discussion** in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) between [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) and Damien Doligez about aging approaches in garbage collection, with historical context on why book-keeping dominated performance improvements in past implementations ([ocaml/RFCs#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
- **Value restriction strategy debate** in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) for types as module arguments, with [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) proposing a two-step approach using strict value restriction initially, then potentially relaxing to weak value restriction later to handle type escaping scenarios ([ocaml/RFCs#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
- **Implementation strategy discussion** in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) with [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) contributing guidance on the phased approach to implementing type parameters with value restriction ([ocaml/RFCs#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Performance-focused development** with major garbage collection optimizations in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) ([ocaml/ocaml#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580), [ocaml/ocaml#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616)) and corresponding theoretical proposals in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) ([ocaml/RFCs#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))
- **Developer experience enhancement** through better error messages and improved debugging support in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with warning system redesign and frame pointer improvements ([ocaml/ocaml#13639](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13639))
- **Type system evolution** with continued GADT improvements in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) ([ocaml/ocaml#13585](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13585)) and advanced module system features discussed in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) ([ocaml/RFCs#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
- **Cross-platform consistency** efforts in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) including symbol name mangling standardization and C++ compatibility improvements for better integration across different environments
- **Collaborative RFC process** maturation with iterative proposal refinement as seen in [Christophe Raffalli](https://github.com/craff)'s three GC proposal attempts in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) ([ocaml/RFCs#48](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/48), [ocaml/RFCs#49](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/49), [ocaml/RFCs#50](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/50))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major Saturn 1.0 release preparation with platform compatibility fixes across eio, picos, and eio-trace
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Saturn 1.0 approaching release, FreeBSD socket compatibility, js_of_ocaml fixes, and tracing improvements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Saturn 1.0 release preparation** reached completion with new lockfree bag implementation and comprehensive documentation standardization across data structures ([ocaml-multicore/saturn#123](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/123), [ocaml-multicore/saturn#173](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/173))
- **FreeBSD compatibility** improvement in socket close operations to handle `ECONNRESET` errors automatically in eio ([ocaml-multicore/eio#786](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/786))
- **js_of_ocaml compatibility** restored in picos by removing reference to `caml_ml_domain_id` on OCaml 4 ([ocaml-multicore/picos#333](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/333))
- **Fiber lifetime tracking** bug fixed in eio-trace where fibers ending before suspend operations would incorrectly appear active ([ocaml-multicore/eio-trace#44](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace/issues/44))
- **Cohttp 6.0.0 upgrade** completed in picos with API adjustments removing deprecated parameters ([ocaml-multicore/picos#335](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/335))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Five active repositories** with substantial development activity while four repositories (domainslib, meio, kcas, ocaml-iomux) showed no activity this week
- **Saturn repository** dominated activity with comprehensive 1.0 release preparation including five new PRs and extensive issue closure
- **Platform compatibility** focus across multiple repositories with FreeBSD fixes in eio and js_of_ocaml compatibility in picos
- **[Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5)** contributed across three repositories (eio, ocaml-uring, eio-trace) demonstrating cross-project coordination
- **Maintenance and stability** emphasized with dependency upgrades in picos and debugging assistance in ocaml-uring
group_summaries.activity_summary: 11 PRs across repositories with Saturn leading development, plus comprehensive issue resolution and debugging support
group_summaries.activity:
- **Saturn development surge** with [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) opening five PRs including lockfree bag implementation ([ocaml-multicore/saturn#173](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/173)), skiplist documentation ([ocaml-multicore/saturn#172](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/172)), and README updates ([ocaml-multicore/saturn#169](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/169))
- **File system operations** expansion in eio with [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) implementing new `chmod` support ([ocaml-multicore/eio#785](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/785)) and test infrastructure improvements ongoing ([ocaml-multicore/eio#778](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/778))
- **Picos compatibility maintenance** with [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) handling js_of_ocaml fixes, cohttp upgrades, and opening draft PR for structured Run operations ([ocaml-multicore/picos#334](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/334))
- **Debug support provided** for ocaml-uring with [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) assisting [Krzysztof Leśniak](https://github.com/serpent7776) in resolving io_uring hang investigation ([ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#119](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/issues/119))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **[Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5)** active across three repositories: implementing FreeBSD socket fixes in [ocaml-multicore/eio#786](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/786), providing debugging support in [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#119](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/issues/119), and fixing fiber display timing in [ocaml-multicore/eio-trace#44](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio-trace/issues/44)
- **Platform compatibility coordination** with FreeBSD improvements in eio and js_of_ocaml compatibility fixes in picos addressing similar cross-platform development challenges
- **Tracing ecosystem support** with eio-trace improvements directly benefiting eio users who rely on trace visualization for debugging concurrent applications
- **Infrastructure resilience** demonstrated by OCaml-CI improvements eliminating need for OpenBSD-specific workarounds in picos ([ocaml-multicore/picos#331](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/331))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Performance optimization discussion** in Saturn regarding `copy_as_padded` usage patterns and memory overhead concerns raised by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) ([ocaml-multicore/saturn#171](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/171))
- **API design discussion** about Saturn.Queue.push interface consistency with [Shuntian Liu](https://github.com/Vincent-lau) questioning design choices and [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) providing detailed rationale ([ocaml-multicore/saturn#149](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/149))
- **js_of_ocaml breakage** identified and reported by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) affecting picos.thread on OCaml < 5 with proposed solution ([ocaml-multicore/picos#332](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/332))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Release preparation focus** with Saturn 1.0 approaching and comprehensive documentation standardization becoming the primary development pattern
- **Cross-platform compatibility** emerging as key priority with FreeBSD socket handling improvements and js_of_ocaml compatibility fixes addressing diverse deployment environments
- **Dependency maintenance cycles** apparent with cohttp 6.0.0 upgrades and infrastructure improvements reducing platform-specific workarounds
- **Thomas Leonard's cross-repository involvement** indicating technical leadership and coordination across multiple multicore ecosystem components

weekly_summary.brief_summary: Major release week with Dune 3.17.0, Merlin 5.3, OCaml-LSP 1.20.0, template instantiation features, and comprehensive WebAssembly backend integration
weekly_summary.new_features_summary: WebAssembly backend, template instantiation, custom LSP navigation, capsule API enhancements, Saturn 1.0 preparation, and governance framework establishment

-**Modal module semantics** discussion between [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) regarding empty mode list handling, confirming syntax-only implementation without typedtree semantics ([oxcaml/merlin#120](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/120))
multicore: -**API design discussion** about Saturn.Queue.push interface consistency with [Shuntian Liu](https://github.com/Vincent-lau) questioning design choices and [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) providing detailed rationale ([ocaml-multicore/saturn#149](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/saturn/issues/149))

weekly_summary.emerging_trends:
- **Major release coordination maturity** demonstrated through synchronized delivery of three toolchain releases (Dune 3.17.0, Merlin 5.3, OCaml-LSP 1.20.0) within the same week, showing improved ecosystem release management across __RUMINANT:tools__ with coordinated timing and feature alignment
- **WebAssembly ecosystem integration** with complete backend merge in __RUMINANT:tools__ ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml)) and build system support in Dune 3.17.0, indicating production-ready WebAssembly compilation reaching maturity for modern browser deployment
- **Governance framework formalization** across __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ with comprehensive repository policies establishing clear criteria for package inclusion, archiving procedures, and maintenance guidelines, reflecting ecosystem maturity and standardization priorities
- **Performance-focused development** continuing with systematic GC optimizations in __RUMINANT:core__ ([ocaml/ocaml#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580), [ocaml/ocaml#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616)), CFG backend refactoring in __RUMINANT:oxcaml__, and Saturn 1.0 optimization work in __RUMINANT:multicore__
- **Cross-platform reliability emphasis** with FreeBSD socket improvements in __RUMINANT:multicore__ ([ocaml-multicore/eio#786](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/786)), Windows package management coordination in __RUMINANT:tools__ ([ocaml/dune#11161](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11161)), and js_of_ocaml compatibility fixes ([ocaml-multicore/picos#333](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/333))
- **LSP protocol extension development** with custom `ocamllsp/jump` requests in __RUMINANT:tools__ ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1374](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/pull/1374)) extending beyond standard LSP capabilities for editor-agnostic OCaml-specific functionality
- **Type system advancement** with GADT improvements in __RUMINANT:core__ ([ocaml/ocaml#13585](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13585)), modal module syntax in __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ ([oxcaml/merlin#120](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/120)), and types as module arguments theoretical development ([ocaml/RFCs#40](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/40))
- **Quality assurance modernization** through CI linting integration proposals in __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ ([ocaml/opam-repository#26959](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26959)) and emergency response procedures for package breakage, showing shift toward proactive validation workflows
